item.title: Count Set Bits
item.description: Write a program to count set bits of an integer. Set bits: 1 - set-bit 0- unset-bit

item.title: Notes on Rust
item.description: Memory Stack Special region of the process memory that stores variables created by each function. For every function call a new stack frame is allocated on top of the current one.

item.title: Pointers & Arrays
item.description: Pointers Data & functions used in a program are stored inside the operative memory of the computer. Every byte of the operative memory has a label, called address, represented by a hexadecimal number, prefixed with 0x.

item.title: Program Components
item.description: Directives Code lines that start with # are read and interpreted by the preprocessor before the program is compiled. 1 #include<iostream> // includes iostream header file int main() / главна функция Special function, contained in all C++ programs, that is being called first when a program is run.

item.title: Very short history of C++
item.description: The C language was created and developed alongside the UNIX OS - First version is created by Dennis Ritchie in 1973 - In 1977 UNIX was rewritten in C - It was initially designed for developing operating systems, but other applications were soon found
